captions.text: EPISODE TWO: STEPPING UP IN SWEDEN
DAVID 'TITI' ACCAM: NIKE CHANCE WINNER 2010
WHEN I'M OUT IN TOWN, I GET THE KIDS ALWAYS COMING TO ME FOR AUTOGRAPHS...
...AND SOME OF THEM START SINGING MY NAME...WHICH IS COOL.
I CAN'T SING IT IN SWEDISH, BUT IT MEANS...
"DAVID ACCAM, SCORES AGAIN..."
HELSINGBORG IS BIGGER THAN ÖSTERSUND AND IT'S CLOSE TO ALL THE BIG CITIES...
...GOTHENBURG, MALMÖ, COPENHAGEN.
SEEING PEOPLE, WEARING YOUR SHIRT, SINGING YOUR NAME...
...IT MEANS A LOT, SO YOU JUST GO ON THE PITCH...
...AND TRY TO DO YOUR BEST FOR THE TEAM.
I'M ABOUT TO GO TO MY SWEDISH LESSON...
I FEEL REALLY BAD BECAUSE SOMETIMES I DON'T REALLY DO MY HOMEWORK!
YES. MY WHOLE BODY HURTS. WE REARRANGED THE LIVING ROOM YESTERDAY.
MOST OF THE SESSION IS TAKEN IN SWEDISH.
WHEN A COACH SPECIFICALLY WANTS TO SAY SOMETHING TO ME...
...MAYBE TWO TOUCHES, THREE TOUCHES, DO THIS, DO THAT...
...I DO UNDERSTAND HIM.
IF YOU WANT TO PLAY WELL YOU HAVE TO GET USED TO ALL THIS STUFF...
...SO YOU HAVE TO SACRIFICE A BIT OF TIME TO LEARN THE LANGUAGE.
IT'S ALWAYS DIFFICULT WHEN YOU'RE FAR FROM HOME, LIVING IN A DIFFERENT COUNTRY...
...DIFFERENT PLACE. SO IT WAS NICE WHEN I MET MABEL.
SHE'S LIKE A MOTHERLY FIGURE FOR ME HERE...
...SHE ALWAYS ADVISE ME, TALK TO ME AND SOMETIMES COOK...
...NICE GHANAIAN DISHES FOR ME TO EAT.
I'VE NEVER MET ANY GHANAIAN HERE IN HELSINGBORG.
MOST OF THE TIME IF I DON'T SEE HIM AND I CALL HIM...
"I HAVEN'T SEEN YOU FOR THREE OR FOUR DAYS, WHAT'S HAPPENING?"
'I'M TIRED. I'M SLEEPING. I NEED TO REST'
HE RESTS A LOT BECAUSE HE'S ALWAYS TRAINING.
LAST TIME THEY PLAYED, HE WON THE MAN OF THE MATCH.
AND I GOT THE HONOUR, THEY GAVE ME THE FLOWERS AND THEY'RE VERY BEAUTIFUL ONES.
FOR ME, MY TARGET WAS TO IMPROVE EVERY GAME.
I'VE IMPROVED A LOT AND I'M ON A DIFFERENT LEVEL COMPARED...
...THE BEGINNING OF THE SEASON.
I'VE PLAYED 24 GAMES, SCORED TEN AND FOUR ASSISTS...
...SO NOT BAD FOR A WINGER.
I'M REALLY HAPPY TO SEE ALL THE GUYS FROM THE ACADEMY...
...DOING REALLY WELL FOR THEMSELVES.
ESPECIALLY TOM ROGIC, FOR ME HE WAS THE BEST PLAYER FROM THE ACADEMY
I'M NOT SURPRISED HE'S PLAYING FOR CELTIC...
...AND BEING CALLED FOR THE NATIONAL TEAM.
IT WAS GREAT WHEN I GOT THE CALL FROM THE COACH TO PLAY FOR THE NATIONAL TEAM.
AFTER THE CALL I PHONED MY PARENTS AND THEY WERE IN SHOCK...
...BECAUSE THEY DIDN'T EXPECT ME TO BE IN THE NATIONAL TEAM THIS TIME.
IT'S JUST NICE WHEN PEOPLE APPRECIATE WHAT YOU'RE DOING...
...AND THEY'RE PROUD OF YOU BECAUSE OF WHAT YOU DO ON THE PITCH.
FOR ME, I'M REALLY LOOKING FORWARD TO FINISHING THE SEASON ON A GOOD NOTE...
...AND GOING BACK TO GHANA TO SEE ALL MY FAMILY AND FRIENDS.
SOMETIMES YOU NEED A BREAK TO JUST SIT DOWN...
...AND THINK ABOUT HOW FAR YOU'VE COME...
...AND HOW FAR YOU WANT TO GO.
I JUST WANT TO IMPROVE EVERY DAY...
...NOT ONLY AS A FOOTBALLER...
...BUT ALSO AS A PERSON.
WHATEVER IT TAKES.

title: Nike Football: Whatever It Takes - Episode Two
